speaker: Best-Edited Half-Hour Series for Television
text: Ron Volk  EMMY
nextSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series
text: Ron Volk  ## Nominated  AMERICAN COMEDY AWARD
nextSpeaker: Funniest Female Guest Appearance in a TV Series

speaker: Funniest Female Guest Appearance in a TV Series
text: Bebe Neuwirth  * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    **THE ICE WOMAN COMETH** _Scene One -- KACL Frasier is on the air.  He has just begun to listen to Betsy._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Picture Editing for a Series

speaker: Frasier
text: Good afternoon, Betsy.  I'm listening.
prevSpeaker: Funniest Female Guest Appearance in a TV Series

speaker: Betsy
text: [_v.o._] Hi, Dr. Crane.  My problem is that my husband wants to take me on a cruise for our anniversary.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that sounds enchanting.

speaker: Betsy
text: Yes, except I keep having this dream where I'm in a cabin asleep, and I see a drop of water beginning to leak up and at first it's just a trickle, but then it's a stream, and then it's gushing, pouring water everywhere and there's nothing in the world that I can do to stop this. _These words eventually get to Roz and all she can do is leave without permission._

speaker: Frasier
text: That's a very powerful image, wouldn't you say so, Roz? [_sees she has gone_] Roz agrees. _Meanwhile, Roz bumps into Boston's ice woman in the corridor. Roz, however, must cross her legs together._

speaker: Lilith
text: Excuse me, I'm looking for Frasier Crane, they said he was up here.

speaker: Roz
text: Lilith it's me, Roz... Doyle.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_recognizing_] Oh yes, Frasier's fun-loving producer.. [_sees Roz's pregnant lump_] ...who's apparently having a bit too much fun loving.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I'd love to send one back at you, but I gotta pee! _Roz runs off to the little girls' room as Lilith enters listening to Frasier's final thoughts._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on air_] Well that's all the time we have today.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, wishing you a good day and good mental... [_sees Lilith_] AHHH! [_explains_] I'm sorry, someone just walked into the room and frightened me.  It's, uh, my ex-wife, so if you're a regular listener you'll know what I'm talking about! I'll see you Monday.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Surprise.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah well, we're past that now, aren't we?  Well, what brings you to Seattle?

speaker: Lilith
text: I'm here for the national conference on self-psychology.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  And how is Frederick?

speaker: Lilith
text: Fine.  We have an amazing child.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we have.  And, uh, Brian?

speaker: Lilith
text: Fine.  I have an amazing husband.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes.  So, did you two get that gift basket I sent you for the holidays? _Lilith falls down crying as Roz runs back into the booth, confused by the matter._

speaker: Roz
text: What did you do to her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nothing, I sent her a gift basket, fruits and festive nuts!

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, it's not the basket, you nit!  It's Brian... he left me.

speaker: Roz
text: Maybe I should go.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh no, everyone else knows, you might as well know it too. Brian was looking for someone a bit more feminine... and he found him!

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, Stan Jablonski, that little hussy! [_Roz leaves_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, [_takes her in his arms_] Lilith, oh, I am genuinely sorry.

speaker: Lilith
text: I didn't know where to turn, but I knew somehow you'd be here for me.

speaker: Frasier
text: So you didn't come for the conference?

speaker: Lilith
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, you really shouldn't be alone tonight.  Er, Niles and I are atending a reception at the Union Club, would you like to join us?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh thank you Frasier, I'd love to.  I don't if I deserve your compassion, but I feel better already just holding your strong comforting hands.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know I'll always be here for you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, I could stay in these arms all day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, [_looks at watch_] yes - well, em, you'll have to excuse me. I have an appointment, station manager, very important, can't be broken. I'll, em, see you tonight. [_delirious_] Bye bye.  _Frasier slowly walks away.  He is very rigid and cannot believe what has just happened.  He exits as Roz enters._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, that's rough; leaving you for another man!  Did you have any idea?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, none at all.  Stan was a contractor we had hired to extend our master bedroom.  It's ironic, isn't it - no sooner do I get the closet of my dreams than my husband comes out of it.  _Lilith exits, leaving a bewildered Roz behind.  FADE OUT_  **STRANGE INTERLUDE**  _Scene Two - Cafe Nervosa Later that day, Niles is at a table when Frasier enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sees what he's eating_] Mmm, that bun looks good.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, remember your diet.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sits_] Speaking of buns I could do without, Lilith is back!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that explains why blood was pouring from all my faucets this morning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now go easy on her.  Her husband has left her, and get this: for a man.

speaker: Niles
text: Damn!  I owe Dad five dollars!

speaker: Frasier
text: Poor thing, she's obviously devastated - her entire world has been turned upside down.  Oh, look who I'm talking to.  No one knows better than you how much a messy divorce can leave one...

speaker: Frasier
text: ...strangely relaxed!  Niles? [_taps him_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as if nothing had happened_] Yes?

speaker: Frasier
text: Am I boring you?

speaker: Niles
text: Did I do it again?  I'm sorry Frasier, it seems I'm suffering through a bout of narcolepsy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord!  When did this start?

speaker: Niles
text: Right after we started divorce proceedings.  I checked with my doctor, I'm fine - it's a reaction to stress.  It's my way of escaping the whole ugly mess!  But I'm terribly sorry, go on with what you were saying.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, obviously Lilith is distraught and she's come to me to help her make sense of the whole thing.  I find it just a bit disconcerting.

speaker: Niles
text: How so?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we have a destructive pattern: whenever she comes to me in need I find her vulnerability highly desirable; against my better judgment we end up in bed and I'm left with feelings of regret.

speaker: Niles
text: And you felt this way about her today?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh baby!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, do your best to avoid her.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I can't!  She's joining us at the Union Club tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: What, she's going to be there?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on Niles, it's just a bunch of stuffed shirts talking about their portfolios and prostates.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly, and you've ruined it!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to phone_] Yes? [_to Frasier_] Damn, it's one of Maris's cadre of lawyers. [_to phone_] Er, we've been over that.  No, I can't.  How dare you?  She already has the house!  I'm not even allowed to visit the koi pond!  Uh-huh.  Uh-huh...

speaker: Niles
text: ...I'm not even allowed to visit the koi pond!

speaker: Frasier
text: Give me that! [_takes phone from Niles and speaks into it_] He will call you back. [_hangs up_] Lord, aren't we a pair: a narcoleptic and a weak-willed sexual obsessive.  We're like a couple of brothers out of an O'Neill play!  [_N.B. Eugene O'Neill, American playwright - all the title cards are based on the titles of his plays._] _FADE TO:  Scene Three - Apartment Later in Frasier's apartment Martin is talking to Eddie.  Daphne is tidying up._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey Daph', come down here, I taught him a new trick.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I love animal tricks.  You know, I was reading in a movie magazine where there's this stunt dog who they taught to ride a motorcycle into a burning building, pick up a baby in its teeth, then jump out the window to safety.  What did you teach Eddie?

speaker: Martin
text: [_mock proud_] To roll over.

speaker: Daphne
text: You must be very proud.

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, forget it, Eddie!

speaker: Martin
text: Hello, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Evening, dad, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters from kitchen_] Hello, Niles.  Sherry?  I think we have time before Lilith arrives.

speaker: Martin
text: [_scared_] What?!  You never said she was coming up here!

speaker: Daphne
text: You just said you were going to dinner!

speaker: Martin
text: You never said she was coming up here!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's just to rendezvous, it's all of two minutes.

speaker: Martin
text: But you never told me!  You've been home an hour and you never told me, not a word, [_to Daphne_] did he say anything to you?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, nothing. [_to Frasier_] You could have told us, you know, we could have made plans to be elsewhere.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Daphne_] How come you didn't know about it?  You used to know these things, whenever she came around you'd get a headache!

speaker: Frasier
text: Alright, she's coming!  Both of you suck it up!  Lilith has had a devastating week; her husband has left her.  The least you could do is show a little compassion, unless you'd like to hide in your rooms because two minutes of polite conversation with a woman in need is too much to ask!

speaker: Martin
text: Outta my way!

speaker: Daphne
text: Me too! _They run for the hall and Martin drops his cane.  Daphne moves to pick it up-_

speaker: Martin
text: Leave it! _When they have left Niles picks the cane up and stands it up. Frasier goes to answer the door._

speaker: Niles
text: Remember Frasier, I'm here for you in case you feel yourself starting to weaken.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh I'm fine, believe me: I'm in complete control! _Frasier answers the door to Lilith.  He is knocked back by her appearance. She has her hair down and a short dress on.  She has a silk wrap around her arms._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh baby!

speaker: Lilith
text: Thank you Frasier, I needed that.  I treated myself to a little shopping this afternoon.  Probably just a pathetic attempt to compensate for the battering my ego's taken recently - it's pretty transparent, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with his mind elsewhere_] No, but if you stand in the light maybe...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Lilith
text: [_sees Niles_] Niles, sorry to hear your marriage ended in a shambles.

speaker: Niles
text: Ditto.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now that we've got the pleasantries out of the way, let me take your wrap. _He takes it off her, revealing that the back is cut down to the base of her spine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Yowsa!  Oh Lilith, that dress is stunning.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, may I see you in the kitchen?

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Lilith
text: It's from a new Couture line called "Encore!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... bravo!  I can almost feel the curtain rising!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  Excuse us, we'll be right back.  Eddie will entertain you.  _Frasier and Niles exit to the kitchen.  Lilith is left on her own as Eddie jumps up onto the chair._

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Eddie. _He runs away, leaving her in tears.  Meanwhile, in the kitchen, Niles is getting a drink out of the fridge as Frasier prattles on._

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn her lily-white hide!  She knows what she's doing dressing like that!  That woman plays me like a lute -- well, I guess you know a thing or two about that!  Huh!  I've got all the resistance of a horny stag!  Niles, you've gotta help me get through this... Niles! _Frasier realizes he's fallen asleep again in the fridge.  Frasier wakes him up._

speaker: Niles
text: Did I do it again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, you fell asleep with your cheek right next to the ice tray!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's so strange.  I dreamt I was tangoing with Maris!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, I need your help resisting Lilith!

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, alright, let me think, let me think... I think I have the answer.  When you feel yourself yielding to her, summon an image so repellant you will be incapable of any sexual desire. [_thinks, then_] Remember the summer we were at Uncle Henry's farm and found that dead horse lying in the hot sun crawling with maggots?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.

speaker: Niles
text: Hold onto that picture.  You can ride that horse to safety.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles, that just might do the trick.  When it comes to an ugly image, you can't beat a dead horse! [_guns down his drink_]

speaker: Niles
text: Feel up to facing her again?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  Let her bat her eyes all she wants to, she can push her breasts up to Canada, I won't budge! _Niles chucks him on the shoulder, and they go out again.  FADE TO:_ Scene Four - Hotel In her hotel room, Lilith is lying naked in bed, entwined with a man. However, the man is under the covers.

speaker: Lilith
text: Morning.

speaker: Niles
text: Morning.  _END OF ACT ONE (Time: 10:00)  ACT TWO_  **LONG NIGHT'S JOURNEY INTO DAY** _Scene Five - Hotel Niles and Lilith slowly wake up and realize what they've done. They gasp and pull away from each other in bed._

speaker: Lilith
text: My God!  What did we do?  What did we do?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, first you put your...

speaker: Lilith
text: I know what we did!  What do we do now?!

speaker: Niles
text: Let's just stay calm.  These things happen, they happen every day... [_losing it_] every day in Arkansas!  [_N.B. The line in an earlier draft was, "Everyday in France and people die for it!"_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier is going to kill us!  Oh, why did you have to look so damned bewitching all evening?

speaker: Lilith
text: Why did you have to drive me home and walk me to my door?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, there's no point pointing fingers.  We both know why this happened; last night was simply two wounded people overcome with loneliness, confusion and...

speaker: Lilith
text: Tequila shooters.

speaker: Niles
text: [_moaning_] Mmm-hmm. _There's a knock at the door, which scares Niles to death. Lilith starts to pull on a robe._

speaker: Niles
text: [_whispering_] Who's that?!

speaker: Lilith
text: Don't panic, no one knows we're here.

speaker: Niles
text: I told Frasier I was driving you home.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_panicked, whispering_] Why did you do a stupid thing like that?!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it wasn't stupid at the time!  How did I know the minute we got in this room you'd be on me like a hawk on a titmouse! _The knock sounds again.  Lilith goes to the door while Niles pulls on a robe._

speaker: Lilith
text: Just be quiet. [_clears throat_] Who is it?

speaker: Waiter
text: [_o.s._] Room Service, ma'am.

speaker: Lilith
text: Ah that's right, we ordered breakfast last night.  _Lilith opens the door to a waiter pushing a cart with two plates on it._

speaker: Waiter
text: Good morning ma'am, good morning sir.  I have Eggs Benedict and Eggs Florentine.

speaker: Lilith
text: Did you bring ketchup?

speaker: Waiter
text: Uh, no.  Sorry, let me get that for you right now.

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] Ketchup on Eggs Florentine?

speaker: Waiter
text: [_charmed_] Oh!  Your, uh, first breakfast together?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_mad_] Just get it!

speaker: Niles
text: Now I remember ordering this; it's the breakfast I always have after a night of passion.

speaker: Lilith
text: Eggs Benedict?  That's very rich.

speaker: Niles
text: I only have it once a year.

speaker: Lilith
text: That was quick. [_goes to answer it_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_o.s._] Lilith, are you awake?

speaker: Lilith
text: It's Frasier!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God!  What do we do?

speaker: Lilith
text: Hide in the bathroom!

speaker: Niles
text: Right!

speaker: Niles
text: No, not you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Lilith? _She realizes the food cart could be a sign there are two people there so she has a plan..._

speaker: Lilith
text: Wait, take the cart with you! [_pushes it into bathroom with Niles_]

speaker: Niles
text: [_stops it_] Wait!  Food in the bathroom?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, just go! _Lilith pushes the cart in with Niles and goes to answer the door. It's Frasier, and he's switched on horny mode._

speaker: Lilith
text: Hello, Frasier.  What are you doing here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Surrendering, Lilith.  I'm yours! [_grabs her_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh - no...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh please, don't punish me for playing hard to get last night! It took everything I had to resist you.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, this isn't right...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who cares?! [_embraces her_] You're gonna tell me that when you were lying in your bed last night you weren't thinking about me?

speaker: Lilith
text: [_honestly_] Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, drop the mask, Lilith!  We both know why you came to Seattle. We both know why you dressed so enticingly last night.

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, well... _There is a sound of a toilet flushing from the bathroom.  Lilith looks pensively at Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: There's someone in your bathroom?

speaker: Lilith
text: No, it's a defective toilet.  It's been doing that all night, I think I'll just go check it now. _Lilith enters the bathroom to confront Niles.  However his narcolepsy has taken over and he is asleep on the flush._

speaker: Lilith
text: [_whispering_] Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as if nothing happened_] Yes?

speaker: Lilith
text: You fell asleep and flushed the toilet!

speaker: Niles
text: Damn!  Is he still here?

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes.  He wants to make love to me.

speaker: Niles
text: Does the man have no scruples?!  He specifically asked me last night to keep him away from you.  But the minute my back is turned he sneaks back here - and yes, I'm aware of the irony.

speaker: Lilith
text: I'll just ask him to leave. _Lilith opens the bathroom door and enters the main room to ask Frasier to leave.  However Frasier has already shed his clothes and changed into a dressing gown._

speaker: Lilith
text: My God!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_saucily_] My Goddess!

speaker: Lilith
text: [_to waiter_] Go away!

speaker: Waiter
text: [_o.s._] But I've got your ketchup, ma'am.

speaker: Lilith
text: Not necessary.

speaker: Waiter
text: OK, but I still need the bill.

speaker: Lilith
text: Later.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's just take care of this...

speaker: Waiter
text: I'm sorry to disturb you, but here's the... [_realizes it's a different man_] ketchup. [_hands it over_] Sorry it took so... long.  I, er, still need the bill. [_looks around room_] Where's the cart?

speaker: Lilith
text: In the bathroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why is the breakfast cart in the bathroom?

speaker: Lilith
text: Ah, I was going to take a hot bath while I ate.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still, food in the bathroom?

speaker: Lilith
text: Be right back.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Well, this is a little embarrassing.  My ex-wife, we're sort of reconnecting.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_knowing better_] Yes sir, that's ...er... wonderful.

speaker: Frasier
text: You never know, it might just work out this time.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_sarcastically_] Oh...kay.

speaker: Lilith
text: [_enters with money_] There you go, [_bribing_] There's a generous, _generous_ tip in there for you.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_understanding_] Thank you, ma'am.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say, listen - while you're still here, why don't you send up an order of Eggs Benedict?  There's no reason why she should eat alone.

speaker: Waiter
text: [_looks at Lilith_] Oh...kay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, where were we?

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, this isn't a good time for this, really.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why not?  Lilith, please, we're alone, we're here, you need your Frasier- _There is a clatter in the bathroom; the sound of a dinner tray falling to the floor.  This raises Frasier's suspicions._

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell was that?! [_goes to the bathroom door_]

speaker: Lilith
text: No, Frasier, wait, don't go in there!  Wait! _Lilith tries to keep Frasier back, but he pushes her out of the way and enters the bathroom.  Niles is fast asleep with his head on his order of Eggs Benedict._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!!

speaker: Niles
text: [_as if nothing had happened_] Yes? [_shocked to see Frasier_]

speaker: Frasier
text: My God!

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, I'm sorry, we didn't mean for this to happen...

speaker: Frasier
text: _OH MY GOD!_

speaker: Niles
text: It was a mistake, a horrible, misguided mistake-

speaker: Frasier
text: [_half mad_] Stop it, Niles!  Stop it!  Don't tell me how or why, I've just got to get out of here!

speaker: Lilith
text: Oh, Frasier, Frasier!

speaker: Niles
text: This is my worst nightmare.

speaker: Lilith
text: You have egg on your face.

speaker: Niles
text: That is an understatement!

speaker: Lilith
text: No, actual egg! _Niles looks up at Lilith and we see he has "scrambled eggs all over his face."  Someone knocks on the door again.  She goes to answer it._

speaker: Lilith
text: It's in your hair too!

speaker: Niles
text: I knew you couldn't stay mad at us.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm in a bathrobe, you jackass!

speaker: Lilith
text: I can understand your shock, and believe me, if I could erase everything that happened last night, I would.  But, if you could just look at this rationally, just for a moment - we didn't technically do anything wrong.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_outraged_] What?  You didn't do anything wrong?!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm a little unclear on that myself, but I'm willing to go along with it!

speaker: Lilith
text: You and I are no longer married.  Neither is Niles.  I won't say this is my shining hour, but we are not responsible to you or anyone else for our actions.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're actually defending what you did?!

speaker: Lilith
text: Just listen; the past few days have been THE worst of my life. I have never been less self-assured, or more in need of validation, both as a person and especially as a woman. Niles was feeling the same thing.

speaker: Niles
text: Exactly. [_realizes the woman part_] Wait a minute...

speaker: Lilith
text: Our physical reaction to each other was nothing more than a desperate attempt to reaffirm our own worth.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... that is very impressive, Dr. Sternin.  But I too happen to be a psychiatrist.  Let me tell you what actually transpired.  This was a passive-aggressive manifestation of your deep resentments towards me.  Niles, you were punishing me for my notoriety. [_to Lilith_] You, for my successful adjustment after our divorce.  It is this shared bond that brought the two of you to your palace of sweet revenge!

speaker: Lilith
text: Allow me to rebut: what a crock!

speaker: Frasier
text: It is not!

speaker: Lilith
text: It is so!  This is yet another example of your complete self- absorption, which is the reason we could not stay together in the first place!

speaker: Frasier
text: I have a right to... [_realizes_] Why am _I_ defending myself?!

speaker: Niles
text: If you ask me, you are both off the mark.  Last night was about two people, ruled by very powerful superegos - tortured by them, who found a chance - however misguided - to break through and rediscover their ids together.  Call me an old softie, but that's how I see it.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK, then... the three of us have certainly analyzed the CRAP out of this!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, where do we all go from here?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know. _Niles's mobile rings and he goes to answer it.  Lilith and Frasier try to settle things quietly._

speaker: Lilith
text: You realize that if you had simply given into me last night instead of this morning, the three of us would not be in this hell.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it would be the two of us in a whole different hell!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to phone_] Well, I don't give a damn!  I've been manipulated by you jackals enough, I'll see you in court! [_puts phone away_] The very idea that Maris still thinks she can... [_still alert_] Hey, I'm not sleepy.  That conversation should have put me out like a light!

speaker: Lilith
text: Well, it's not surprising.  Your experience with Maris has been emasculating.  Last night may have gone a long way towards restoring your self-confidence.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course!  And by the same token you can now give up the neurotic assumption that Brian left you because you are unattractive.  You have ample evidence to the contrary.

speaker: Lilith
text: Yes, I have! [_smugly_] Well, to hell with Brian!  If he wants a prissy little wife, he can keep Stan!

speaker: Frasier
text: So, [_sarcastically_] isn't this peachy!  Everything's turned out just fine for everyone.  You two have solved your problems, the waiter received a handsome tip, Niles and I have matching bathrobes, and looky here!  It's not even nine- thirty yet! [_points to watch_]

speaker: Lilith
text: Frasier, try to understand...

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, what happened last night was just...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop it, both of you!  Enough!  It happened, and I'm just going to have to deal with it. [_bitter chuckle_] I suppose in a twisted way there is one positive for me in this: you see, Lilith, I have never stopped desiring you - even though we are forward, whenever I look at you, I will see the back of my brother's head!  And that is one bucket of ice water, let me tell ya!

speaker: Lilith
text: You know, Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Enough, Lilith.

speaker: Lilith
text: Alright.  Maybe, I'll just go... have some breakfast. [_she exits to bathroom_]

speaker: Niles
text: Are we OK?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, we're not... but we will be.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's enough for now. [_waits, and then perkily_] We're an odd little family, aren't we? _There is a voice from the other side of the door - it's the waiter. Niles goes to answer it._

speaker: Waiter
text: Here's your Eggs Benedict, if you could just...

speaker: Waiter
text: Oh...kay!  _The waiter leaves along with this episode as the Crane boys look sorrowfully at each other.  END OF ACT TWO (Time: 21:10)_
